instance_template: frame("Lightweight", 50). frame("Standard", 40). frame("Reinforced", 30). motor("Eco", 60). motor("Standard", 70). motor("HighTorque", 90). battery("SmallCell", 30). battery("MediumCell", 50). battery("LongLife", 80).
generator: 1 { selected_frame(F) : frame(F, E) } 1. 1 { selected_motor(M) : motor(M, E) } 1. 1 { selected_battery(B) : battery(B, E) } 1.

hard_constraints.description: To maintain the physical integrity of the drone, we must ensure that the lightweight frame is never paired with a high-torque motor, as the frame cannot handle that level of mechanical stress.
Because the long-life battery is significantly heavier than other options, it requires the structural support of a reinforced frame to be carried safely.
High-torque motors have intense power requirements that can only be met by the high capacity of a long-life battery.
Small-cell batteries have limited current output and are only powerful enough to operate the eco-friendly motor type.
Medium-cell batteries provide a moderate amount of power, making them incompatible with high-torque motors; they must only be used with eco or standard motors.

soft_constraints.description: To maximize the drone's endurance, we assign a benefit based on the selected frame's efficiency rating.
We prioritize motors that contribute to longer flight times by adding their endurance score to the total configuration value.
The battery's capacity is a major factor in flight duration, so we reward choices that offer higher endurance scores.

global_objective: #minimize { Cost, Name, ID : penalty(Name, ID, Cost) }.
